channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Arsenal squander two-goal lead as Wolves score late to earn draw
item.description: A Ricardo Calafiori own goal in the 94th minute gives Wolves a point. as the Premier League's bottom side come back from two goals down against leaders Arsenal at Molineux.

item.title: What Guardiola's old newspaper column reveals about Man City's new tactics
item.description: Pep Guardiola is using new tactics this season. This is why Manchester City's attack is now so narrow.

item.title: 'Bottle word will be used' as Arsenal blow title advantage
item.description: After blowing a two-goal lead to draw against the Premier League's bottom club Wolves, there will be no dodging the questions on whether Arsenal are mentally ready to end their 22-year wait to become champions.

item.title: Gordon channels Shearer after breaking his record
item.description: Newcastle's Anthony Gordon only had one thought in his mind as his side faced Qarabag in the Champions League...

item.title: Watch all four Gordon goals against Qarabag
item.description: Watch Anthony Gordon's four goals against Qarabag, making him Newcastle's top scorer in the Champions League (10), overtaking Alan Shearer (6).

item.title: Vinicius: Eight years at Real Madrid, 20 cases of alleged racist abuse
item.description: Spanish football expert Guillem Balague details how Vincius Jr has become a global symbol of resistance against discrimination.

item.title: Montemurro on home Asian Cup, WSL pressure & fixing cultures
item.description: As a club coach with Arsenal, Juventus and Lyon and an international coach with Australia, Joe Montemurro has experience of pressure from both sides as he talks to BBC Sport.

item.title: Benfica allege 'defamation campaign' after Vinicius accuses Prestianni of racial abuse
item.description: Benfica claim there is a "defamation campaign" against Gianluca Prestianni as Uefa launch an investigation into claims he racially abused Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr.

item.title: Balague details aftermath of Vinicius racism allegation
item.description: Champions League Match of the Day pundit Guillem Balague, who attended Real Madrid's match at Benfica, explains the aftermath of the alleged racist incident between Vinicius Jr and Gianluca Prestianni.

item.title: Williams and White react to fans' WSL hot takes
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Fara Williams and Ellen White give their opinion on fans' WSL hot takes from Reddit.

item.title: Gordon makes history as Newcastle thrash Qarabag
item.description: Anthony Gordon scores four goals to overtake Alan Shearer as Newcastle's all-time leading goalscorer in the Champions League, as Eddie Howe's side earn a 6-1 away win over Qarabag in the first leg of their play-off match.

item.title: Bodo/Glimt stun Inter to take unlikely first-leg lead
item.description: Bodo/Glimt score two goals in three minutes to stun Inter Milan in a famous 3-1 home win for the Norwegian champions, in the first leg of their Champions League knockout round play-off.

item.title: Arsenal were nowhere near our standards - Arteta
item.description: Mikel Arteta says he is "incredibly disappointed" with his side losing a two goal lead, as Arsenal draw 2-2 against bottom of the table Wolves at Molineux in the Premier League.

item.title: Man Utd regret Rashford decision - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United have regrets over Marcus Rashford deal, Marcos Senesi wants to join Barcelona, Liam Delap could leave Chelsea this summer, plus more.

item.title: 'It hurts a lot' - Coutinho announces Vasco exit
item.description: Phillipe Coutinho says he is leaving boyhood club Vasco da Gama because he is "tired mentally" and his "cycle at the club has ended".

item.title: Leicester appoint Rowett until end of season
item.description: Championship strugglers Leicester City confirm former player Gary Rowett as their new manager on a deal until the end of the season.

item.title: Past Kane & chasing Mbappe - why Gordon is lethal in Europe
item.description: BBC Sport pundit Leon Osman says he can see Anthony Gordon scoring more goals in the Champions League if Newcastle United continue to play him up front with Nick Woltemade in behind, after the Englishman scored four goals in his side's 6-1 win over Qarabag in the knockout round play-offs.

item.title: Galatasaray beat Juventus in seven-goal thriller
item.description: Galatasaray will take a three-goal lead to Turin after coming from behind to beat Juventus in a frenetic first leg of their Champions League knockout phase play-off tie.

item.title: Schick puts Leverkusen in control against Olympiakos
item.description: Patrick Schick scores twice to give Bayer Leverkusen a 2-0 away win over Olympiakos in the first leg of their UEFA Champions knockout round play-off.

item.title: Watch: Vini Jr reports alleged racism from Benfica's Prestianni
item.description: Real Madrid's Vinicius Junior reacts to alleged racist abuse from Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni in the Champions League

item.title: 'The tone was set by Mourinho' - Benfica criticised by Kick It Out
item.description: The chair of Kick It Out, Sanjay Bhandari, says the lack of support from Benfica and the response of their manager Jose Mourinho has "set the tone" in the racism row between the Portuguese club and Real Madrid.

item.title: Is England on course for fifth Champions League spot?
item.description: Could the Premier League get an extra place in the Champions League again? This is how it looks at the end of the league phases.

item.title: What is Uefa's racism protocol and is it working?
item.description: Rather than player welfare, the focus was about racism protocol and process. Did this fail Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr against Benfica?

item.title: Qatari club rival Charlton for Antonio
item.description: Michail Antonio is in talks with Qatari club Al‑Sailiya as well as Championship side Charlton Athletic as he looks to return to regular football following his near-fatal car crash.

item.title: Pubs to open late for home nations World Cup knockout games
item.description: Football fans in the UK will be able to enjoy an extra round at the pub thanks to new rules during the men's World Cup.

item.title: Is VAR any better in the rest of Europe's top leagues?
item.description: You do not need to look far to find people proclaiming that VAR works fine outside the Premier League. BBC Sport spoke to people across Europe's top leagues to find out.

item.title: Hearts must relish pressure of title chance - McInnes
item.description: Hearts head coach Derek McInnes says they have to "relish the opportunity" to win the Scottish Premiership as the pressure rises in the final weeks of the season.

item.title: Alleged Vinicius racism shameful but not surprising - Tullis-Joyce
item.description: Manchester United goalkeeper Phallon Tullis-Joyce says it is "shameful but not surprising" that football continues to be blighted by racism.

item.title: 'We created fire' - Forest boss Pereira on Marinakis reunion
item.description: Nottingham Forest boss Vitor Pereira says "he trusts my work, I trust his personality" as he is reunited with Evangelos Marinakis.

item.title: Can you name every team to finish top or bottom in Premier League?
item.description: We want you to name every team who has finished top or bottom in the Premier League era. Good luck!

item.title: Arsenal make Saka best-paid player with new five-year deal
item.description: England winger Bukayo Saka commits his future to Premier League leaders Arsenal by signing a new five-year deal.

item.title: Real Madrid win against Benfica overshadowed by racist abuse
item.description: Real Madrid's Champions League knockout phase play-off tie at Benfica was halted for 10 minutes after Vinicius Junior reported alleged racist abuse and he and his team-mates left the field.

item.title: Doue inspires PSG to surprise comeback at Monaco
item.description: Substitute Desire Doue inspired holders Paris St-Germain to an impressive comeback against 10-man Monaco in the first leg of their Champions League knockout phase play-off tie.

item.title: Club Brugge score late to draw against Atletico Madrid
item.description: Club Brugge scored a dramatic late equaliser as they twice fought back against Atletico Madrid to leave their Champions League knockout phase play-off tie delicately poised.

item.title: Guirassy guides Dortmund to first-leg lead over Atalanta
item.description: Borussia Dortmund take a two-goal lead into the second leg of their Champions League knockout phase play-off tie after a routine home win against Atalanta.

item.title: Watch: Dundee United edge out Spartans in Scottish Cup
item.description: Watch as Dundee United survive an early red card - and a late comeback from League 2 visitors Spartans - to win 2-1 and set up a Scottish Cup quarter-final away to Premiership rivals Falkirk.

item.title: Fishlock to join Wales staff for opening qualifier
item.description: Jess Fishlock will join Rhian Wilkinson's coaching staff for part of Wales' international camp in March before leaving to fulfil club commitments with Seattle Reign.

item.title: Feyenoord training moved to Belgium for Sterling
item.description: Feyenoord will train in Belgium this week instead of their home in Rotterdam so new signing Raheem Sterling can work with his new team-mates.

item.title: 'Some people think it's live' - how is the commentary in EA Sports FC 26 put together?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the commentary in best-selling football video game EA FC 26 is put together.

item.title: 'We really messed up' - does European football need more balance?
item.description: One set of clubs dominate the Champions League, another win their domestic title every year but cannot compete - does European football have a problem?

item.title: Bicycle kicks & set-piece magic - FA Cup fourth round best goals
item.description: Watch the best goals from across the FA Cup fourth-round weekend, including a stunning free kick from Mansfield's Louis Reed and a strike from outside the box by Newcastle's Sandro Tonali.

item.title: Own goal helps Brentford end Macclesfield's FA Cup run
item.description: Macclesfield's FA Cup dream ends in cruel fashion as Brentford win 1-0 after an own goal by Sam Heathcote.

item.title: Was Tullis-Joyce's 'tactical injury' a smart move? Fara thinks so
item.description: Fara Williams suggests that Phallon Tullis‑Joyce's 'tactical injury' was a clever move, as it gave Manchester United players the chance to receive instructions - guidance that subsequently contributed to their goal in the 2–1 victory over London City Lionesses.

item.title: Spurs unstoppable in 10-goal thriller against Aston Villa
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur put 7 goals past Aston Villa to keep themselves in the running for a Champions League place.

item.title: Arsenal put four past Wigan in FA Cup
item.description: Watch highlights as an early flurry of Arsenal goals saw them ease to a comfortable victory over Wigan to reach the fifth round of the FA Cup.

item.title: How Robert Duvall became an unlikely Scottish football cult hero
item.description: Hollywood actor Robert Duvall, who died on Monday, played Scottish football manager Gordon McLeod in 2000 film A Shot at Glory, which also starred former Ranger Striker Ally McCoist.

item.title: Ratcliffe, Man Utd and the immigration comments fallout
item.description: Sports editor Dan Roan analyses the potential fallout of Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe's comments on immigration.

item.title: 'Golazo!'- why one of football's most iconic intros has returned
item.description: BBC Sport looks at a feature of Serie A coverage which is delighting fans once more, three decades after the height of its popularity.

item.title: Three years on, Deulofeu is still fighting for 'miracle' return
item.description: Gerard Deulofeu has not played for more than three years but believes he can make "history" by fighting for a "miracle" comeback.

item.title: FA Cup winners' medal, Odegaard's armband and Pictionary with Arteta
item.description: As his team prepare to face his old club Arsenal, Wigan midfielder Matt Smith tells BBC Sport about his FA Cup final winners' medal and the advice Mikel Arteta gave him before he left.

item.title: 'A throwback' - Wolves beat Grimsby in FA Cup mudbath
item.description: Premier League Wolves edge League Two Grimsby in an "old school cup tie" which provided an FA Cup "throwback".

item.title: All February's done deals, including deadline day, in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: How does the Nations League work and when is the draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the Uefa Nations League works ahead of the draw for the 2026-27 competition

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Scottish gossip:
item.description: Scotland midfielder criticise VAR in his homeland as Celtic manager backs Japan midfielder.

item.title: Pressley backs Dundee's Graham for Premier League
item.description: Manager Steven Pressley backs in-demand Dundee defender Luke Graham to play in the Premier League and represent Scotland.

item.title: Lyon loan helping 'explosive' Endrick's World Cup 'dream' with Brazil
item.description: Real Madrid striker Endrick's impact on loan at Lyon has been immediate, and is fuelling the teenager's "dream" of playing for Brazil at the World Cup.

item.title: Lucky break that changed Alexander-Arnold's Real future
item.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold endured a difficult start at Real Madrid but his prospects are looking up - and it might earn him a ticket to the World Cup.

item.title: Barcelona withdraw from European Super League project
item.description: Barcelona withdraw from the European Super League project, leaving rivals Real Madrid as the only one of the original 12 clubs still signed up to the plans.

item.title: Cologne youth team break record with 50,000 crowd
item.description: Cologne's Under-19s break the attendance record for a Uefa Youth League match with 50,000 people watching the side take on Inter Milan.

item.title: Ex-Villa striker Duran signs for sixth club aged 22
item.description: Former Aston Villa striker Jhon Duran joins the sixth club of his career at the age of just 22 as he signs for Zenit St Petersburg on loan.

item.title: Williamson returns for World Cup qualifiers
item.description: England captain Leah Williamson returns to the squad as they prepare to begin their 2027 Women's World Cup qualifying campaign.

item.title: Frank's downfall: Inside his struggle to get players and fans onboard
item.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked as Tottenham manager after just eight months in charge. BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel takes a closer look at his tenure.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.
